item.title: DG-FEDORA: A Portable FEDORA Repository
item.description: Teaser Late last night (don’t ask how late it was) I discovered a really slick trick, aka “feature”, of docker-compose. Full disclosure: I love docker-compose “overrides”, a feature I found a couple of months ago. However, implementing overrides in a granular fashion, as I’d like, and within a docker-compose hierarchy of environments like the ISLE stack, can be difficult and counter-productive. I may have found a workable compromise last night. If you’re interested, please, read on… History About a year ago I created a “portable” FEDORA object repository “on a stick”, a USB stick.

item.title: Debugging ISLE-ld (Local Development) in PHPStorm
item.description: Debugging ISLE on a Mac This guidance applies to debugging PHP code in a local ISLE-ld, that’s http://isle.localdomain, instance using PHPStorm. Modify ISLE’s docker-compose.override.yml Before engaging PHPStorm we need to make one change to our ISLE-ld configuration by running a docker cp command, making a change to our docker-compose.override.yml file, and restarting the stack.
